feels.name: Joy
feels.quote: Their happiness was then complete. Their husbands would not have known them.

causedByEvent.name: Taking off shoes and stockings and letting feet hang in the water

takePlaceAt.name: Sitting under a pine tree by the sea

feels.name: Serene
feels.quote: The disappointment of not going to be able to prepare a welcome for Mrs. Fisher had evaporated at once, for it was impossible to go on being disappointed in heaven.

causedByEvent.name: Realization of being in a beautiful place

takePlaceAt.name: Observing the beauty of the garden

feels.name: Acceptance
feels.quote: They were just cups of acceptance.

feels.name: Calm
feels.quote: The vicar, she knew, would have called Lottyâ€™s talk levity, if not profanity. How old he seemed from here; an old, old vicar.

feels.name: Annoyance
feels.quote: Lady Caroline scowled at the cook.

feels.name: Anger
feels.quote: Lady Caroline repudiated angrily the assumption that the cook was her mother.

feels.name: Irritation
feels.quote: Lady Caroline countermanded the cream, feeling she had been extravagant.
